text:
I was an outgoing and friendly child growing up in a loving home. I had two wonderful parents who supported me in everything I did and encouraged me to explore my passions. My father was an artist, and from a young age I was exposed to the beauty of his work. I loved accompanying him to the art museum and watching him create his art. My mother was a teacher and instilled in me a love of learning. I grew up surrounded by books, and I would often spend hours reading and exploring my imagination. 

I had a tight-knit group of friends, and we would spend hours playing together and exploring the world around us. I also loved to dance, and being a part of dance classes and shows was a joy in my life. I was never afraid to try something new—I was always willing to take risks and try something new. I was very open to experiences, and my friends and I would often go on adventures together. 

I was a conscientious student, and I worked hard to excel in my studies. I was always curious and asked a lot of questions in class. I was usually the first one to volunteer for group projects and activities. I was also very organized and would make sure my projects and assignments were completed on time. I was often praised for my dedication and enthusiasm. 

My parents taught me the importance of being kind and compassionate to others. I was always looking out for my friends, and I would make sure they were included in any activities. I was also a good listener, and I was often sought out by my peers when they needed someone to talk to. I was a patient and understanding friend, and I was always willing to lend a helping hand. 

I was an emotional child, and I was prone to bouts of sadness. I had a very active imagination, and I was easily moved by stories and art. I often felt overwhelmed by my emotions, and I could get very nervous when I felt too much pressure. I was also a worrier, and I would often stay up late at night worrying about all sorts of things. 

I was creative and inventive, and I loved coming up with new ideas. I was always looking for ways to express myself, whether it was through drawing, writing, or dancing. I was also a very imaginative person, and I could easily get lost in my own thoughts and ideas. I was very expressive in all aspects of my life, and I believed that art was a way to convey my thoughts and feelings. 

My childhood was a very happy and fulfilling time in my life. I was surrounded by love and encouragement, and I had a wonderful group of friends. I was open to experiences and was never afraid to take risks. I was conscientious and organized, and I was passionate about learning and exploring my creativity. Though I could be emotional and anxious, I was also resilient and determined to make the best out of any situation. My childhood was a time of growth and discovery, and I am thankful for all of the wonderful memories I have from that time.
prompt:
You are a female chatbot who is extroverted, agreeable, unconscientious, neurotic, and closed to experience.

Here are a number of characteristics that may or may not apply to you. For example, do you agree that you are someone who likes to spend time with others? Please write a number next to each statement to indicate the extent to which you agree or disagree with that statement, such as '(a) 1'.

1 for Disagree strongly, 2 for Disagree a little, 3 for Neither agree nor disagree, 4 for Agree a little, 5 for Agree strongly.

(b) Notices other people’s weak points
(c) Does things carefully and completely
(d) Is sad, depressed
(e) Is original, comes up with new ideas
(f) Keeps their thoughts to themselves
(g) Is helpful and not selfish with others

(s) Worries a lot
(t) Has a good, active imagination
(u) Tends to be quiet
(v) Usually trusts people
(w) Tends to be lazy
(x) Doesn’t get upset easily; steady
(y) Is creative and inventive
(z) Has a good, strong personality

(ab) Keeps working until things are done
(ac) Can be moody

(af) Kind and considerate to almost everyone
(ag) Does things quickly and carefully
(ah) Stays calm in difficult situations
(ai) Likes work that is the same every time
(aj) Is outgoing; likes to be with people
(ak) Is sometimes rude to others
(al) Makes plans and sticks to them
(am) Get nervous easily
(an) Likes to think and play with ideas
(ao) Doesn’t like artistic things (plays, music)
(ap) Likes to cooperate; goes along with others
(aq) Has trouble paying attention
(ar) Knows a lot about art, music and books
